record.title: ORDERS FOR WEDNESDAY, MARCH 5, 2008
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR WEDNESDAY, MARCH 5, 2008 -- (Senate - March 04, 2008)

[Page: S1547]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 9:30 a.m., Wednesday, March 5; that following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day, and that the Senate proceed to a period of morning business for up to 1 hour, with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each with the time equally divided and controlled between the two leaders or their designees, with the Republicans controlling the first half and the majority controlling the final half; further, I ask that following morning business the Senate resume consideration of S. 2663, a bill to reform the Consumer Product Safety Commission.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
